WorkItem.Description:
As soon as Rawr starts to load, I receive the following error :  [IsolatedStorage_Operation]
Arguments: 
Debugging resource strings are unavailable. Often the key and arguments provide sufficient information to diagnose the problem. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=106663&Version=4.0.51204.0&File=mscorlib.dll&Key=IsolatedStorage_Operation
 
   at System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageSecurityState.EnsureState()
   at System.IO.IsolatedStorage.IsolatedStorageFile.GetUserStoreForApplication()
   at Rawr.UI.FileUtils.HasQuota(Int32 kilobytes)
   at Rawr.UI.LoadScreen.LoadFiles()
   at Rawr.Silverlight.App.Application_Startup(Object sender, StartupEventArgs e)
   at MS.Internal.CoreInvokeHandler.InvokeEventHandler(Int32 typeIndex, Delegate handlerDelegate, Object sender, Object args)
   at MS.Internal.JoltHelper.FireEvent(IntPtr unmanagedObj, IntPtr unmanagedObjArgs, Int32 argsTypeIndex, Int32 actualArgsTypeIndex, String eventName)
 
Is there a fix for this?

Comments.Message: Yes, you need to allow Rawr access to save data locally. That means that you either explicitly or globally denied Rawr that ability. Check your Silverlight settings.
